summary: The common raven is a big, black bird found across the Northern Hemisphere. It's one of the smartest and largest songbirds, with a wingspan of up to 4 feet. These birds can live for over 23 years and often mate for life. They eat almost anything, from dead animals to fruits and even small animals. People have mixed feelings about them; some see them as pests, while others think they're special and use them in myths and stories. Ravens are known for their problem-solving skills, which shows their intelligence.
title: Common raven
